fi.tuni.mentalrun

Class HighScores

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.Game
      • fi.tuni.mentalrun.GameProject
        • fi.tuni.mentalrun.HighScores
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener, com.badlogic.gdx.Screen, HighScoreListener

    public class HighScores
extends GameProject
implements HighScoreListener, com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    HighScores is for implementing the high scores view.

    HighScores draws the background animation, a turquoise high scores board with a header which tells which level's high scores are currently viewed, a list of the best ten scores for the level and an ok button. HighScores also checks for user input for the ok button. Ok button takes you back HighScoresSelectionMenu. GameProject host is forwarded to HighScoresSelectionMenu. Extends GameProject. Implements interfaces HighScoreListener and Screen.

    Author:
    Joni MÃ¤kinen

                  float statetime)
        Constructs the high scores views.

        Is called in HighScoresSelectionMenu.

        Parameters:
        host - GameProject host
        musicOn - has info if music is toggled
        soundOn - has info if sounds are toggled
        menuBackgroundMusic - the menu background music
        runBackgroundMusic - the run background music
        levelVariable - tells which levels' high scores to fetch
        statetime - makes the screen draw the correct current frame of the animation

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • checkInput

        public void checkInput(boolean cameToSubmit)
        Checks for user input for the ok button.

        Ok button takes you to MainMenu or HighScoresSelectionMenu depending on cameToSubmit's value. If the player has come to HighScores for submitting a high score, they are taken to MainMenu, if they came from HighScoresSelectionMenu, they are taken to HighScoresMenu.

        Parameters:
        cameToSubmit - if true, player came from GameOver. determines which screen is used when the ok button is pressed: main menu or high scores selection menu

      • createNewScore

        public void createNewScore(int levelVariable,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String scoreString)
        Fetches the high scores from HighScoreServer, transforms scoreString, which is the newly submitted score, into an integer form, creates scoreEntry, which contains the name which the player has given and the score the player has acquired and sends levelVariable and scoreEntry to sendNewHighScore at HighScoreServer.
        Parameters:
        levelVariable - an integer value (1, 2 or 3) that has the information on what level's high scores createNewScore is supposed to fetch and send
        name - the name that the player has given during submitting a high score
        scoreString - the string value of the new about to be submitted high score. Is transformed into integer score
